I'd recommend using a different launcher.

good launcher, login broken needs to be fixed

description: Unfortunately this project has been compromised. Do not use.

ignore the other reviews, they're just salty that polymc didn't go the way of the dodo.
in other news the next update will have jinx the cat, worth getting it just for that.

works great for me, but the flatpak is outdated. you can get 1.4.3 on their site.

prism is literally a copy of this with a gay flag added to the logo. i'll stick with poly.
summary: does what it says on the tin

description: This launcher works the same as Prism. Do not let others tell you that this app is compromised because it's not. What happened was a drama surrounding the developers that did not have anything to do with the app. As usual, the code is on GitHub, you can check for any bad codes if you want to. So far, there is none so you can use this launcher normally. CurseForge is not 100% supported so hopefully in near future it will be fully supported.
summary: It works. Don't let other fools you

description: A good working minecraft launcher that works on the steamdeck. Other than having to install differing versions of java depending on what version you want to play works great with only minor issues and bugs here and there.
Fast, simple and has a lot of features such as mod downloading.
app is much better now

I play minecraft with optifine, I like waves in my water and light beams in my sunset. I like that PolyMC made simple work of mods, shaders! my launcher stopped working, I tried PolyMC first, no need to look any further.
summary: Simple, reliable, was actually fun and easy to make and fix mistakes

description: best launcher on steam deck

PolyMC is *the* best Minecraft launcher. It's trully open-source, unlike its father (MultiMC). It has nice developers, unlike its father (MultiMC). And it's developers are willing to adapt to newer packaging formats, unlike its father (Multimc). Just like in MultiMC you can use and manage multiple isolated instances, but it additionally lets you download mods directly from the launcher.

I will chage my review when sound has been fix in this app (that run on steam deck linux) since I could not find any sound setting it more likely to be a fix by update unless I am looking in the right place.
Does what a Minecraft launcher is supposed to do
using it on nobara with nvidia, very nice.
This is basically just a worse version of ATLauncher.

Main developer seized control of the project and locked out all the other contributors, along with nuking the code of conduct with the name of the commit showing "reclaim polymc from the leftoids." Very high risk of malicous code injection in a future update. DO NOT USE

Reportedly this has been taken over by malicious individuals, who have torn up the code of conduct. Check this thread for more details: https://www.reddit.com/r/feedthebeast/comments/y6kfty/polymc_compromised_apparently_according_to/

The github repo for this project has gone private/been hijacked and is now a security risk. Please look into alternatives and do not connect your microsoft account. If you did previously, look into removing access, and uninstall this app
cannot connect account says waiting will update when fixed worked fine yesterday 10/18/2022
This was hijacked by a malicious dev. AVOID until verified to be safe again.

and the backend has gone rouge he removed all maintainer and banned them from everywhere he could

This worked for a while untill I got a prompt that baisically told me to re-add my microsoft account. The software no longer allows me to add my account as the progress bar never progresses. The app won't even let me report a bug. This really sucks since this app is the only way to play java edition on the steam deck.
Do not install! A developer on the team went rogue! Use Prism when it launches!

Drama with the project caused the developers to split, they turned off something to do with the metadata server and you can't login with microsoft accounts anymore.

This won't work anymore, and rumors have been spread stating there's a security issue because of the drama, but in reality some guy's just trying to make life difficult for themselves and nuked the project's development.

I think there'll be a new fork off of it with the kicked out devs called PrismMC, which will be released soon, hopefully that will work

Report bug doesn't even work, which is ironic to say the least. Even tried downloading from the website and had the same problem. Plz fix
Its good but theres a bug with logging into the microsoft accounts where it wont load to let you log in when your sign in expires ? why does my sign in expire ? that is not smart.
PolyMC is by far the best launcher I have ever used. It's easy to set up, you don't have to leave to install mods, and it just works.
good multimc fork
its working 100%%
it is needed a account? btw nice game

- MultiMC, if built from a package manager has features missing, PolyMC has everything enabled.

- Included Java Versions helps settle the hassle of handling multiple versions on your own computer.
just better in every way than the normal launcher. Easier to install than multimc and no data collection!
summary: A W E S O M E

description: Nothing is better than some free and open source software
Includes latest java versions and features that make it a lot easier to use than multimc without losing anything.
Great launcher, the multimc developer refused to add features that other launchers had and in general I don't trust him anymore after he tried sabatoging this project.
summary: Great alternative to multimc and the minecraft launcher

description: This is infinitely better now since I don't have to install MultiMC through a confusing Lutris installer. Now I can just download the flatpak and go! The flatpak doesn't even have issues with some versions of Java that are eneded not being there. All versions that are needed are present! Plus this version has the GPL licence. Open source forever!
summary: An awesome GPL alternative to MultiMC for any distribution!

description: seems like a much more open community, and truly open source

Dieser Minecraft-Launcher benötigt nur 50MB RAM!
Er ist finde ich super!
MultiMC but based and on Flatpak
The offical launcher is sucks, lack of options, but this have a TON of options, also have inbuilt mod manager
summary: Much better than the Offical Launcher

description: This is a fork of MultiMC which was created because the developers were stubborn, rude, and unwilling to adapt to new packaging formats. I suggest you go to MultiMC GitHub and check out the issues for yourself. This fork however, headed by much nicer developers, gives a flawless and easy experience on any distro. As far as I'm concerned, MultiMC will no longer be my launcher of choice.
I prefer this over the vanilla minecraft launcher.
thank you so much for making a fork that is allowed to be packaged
As the title suggests, no problems on SD. Very easy to setup
Mods are really easy to install thanks to the built-in mod manager. Worlds, shader packs, and resource packs can be kept separate from other instances. Overall just a fantastic Minecraft launcher.
Easy to setup, easy to manage multiple instances and mods. PolyMC is best and most powerful launcher for Linux.
They took MultiMC and made it more community-oriented. Saves so much time when working with mods and works great with GameMode and other custom stuff
summary: Incredible timesaver, the best Minecraft launcher

description: Works great on Steam Deck for all your modded Minecraft needs.

Compared to MultiMC, its base project, PolyMC has added support for downloading mods directly from the launcher and supports Flatpaks, as well as generally being more friendly to open source. Compared to the official launcher, it is faster, integrates better with the Linux desktop, and makes managing mods, modpacks, and versions much easier.
summary: Improves on MultiMC; better than official

description: It's a truly open source minecraft launcher. It is a fork of multimc but it's more open source and has a few more/better features like being able to add mods from within the launcher.

Let's face it, the vanilla Minecraft launcher is terrible on the Steam Deck, so a third-party launcher is a given, however, PolyMC isn't just decent, it's awesome. It's so handy being able to install a mod loader and mods right within the launcher interface. Really puts the vanilla experience to shame. Go PolyMC Team!
Die Funktion mehrere Instanzen zu erstellen ist super praktisch! Außerdem kann man Mods einfach hinzufügen.
summary: Es ist super einfach Mods hinzuzufügen!

description: C'est un très bon fork de MultiMC qui fonctionne parfaitement bien sous Fedora 35, et qui n'a pas de problème de stabilité. Franchement je le recommande, le dev à fait un incroyable travail sur se fork en flatpak !!
multiMC en mieux
